page.title: 02Education
page.content:
Fairfax County Primary School.
The Fairfax C.P.School was founded by Sir Thomas Fairfax over 100 years ago. The school consisted of a large room divided by a screen.There was a school house for the headteacher. In 1964/5 the West Riding County Council rehabilitated the school at a cost of approximately Â£30 000.An extra classroom,hall,kitchen,staffroom and toilet facilities were added.Enough land was bought for a playing field. Today the Infant class has the old classroom.It has had a new floor and ceiling,and the walls are covered with cedar boarding.The Juniors have the other classroom.There are 30 children in the school.Some children eat school dinners,others have packed meals.There is a garden,a greenhouse and 2 climbing frames.
